job_title: Patient Access Representative in Kansas City, MO
pros: Awesome benefits, great coworkers, lots of areas to learn. Lots of flexibility on schedule if your PTOC. Paid holidays for part time and full time employees. Various shifts and opportunities to grow within the department, if willing to work for it.
cons: No training manager, so everyone trains you in their way. (Which is fine) but then it isn't consistent. Leaves room for holes in training. Understaffed, due to covid. If you become part time or full-time and they give you a set schedule. Its set to change based on their needs. Doesn't matter if you are the main person there, they will pull you and state "its within your other job requirements." Sometimes that can be for areas you haven't worked in or been trained in for over a year.

The job was formed due to covid and not meant to be long term, so no benefits were earned.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in North Kansas City, MO
pros: There are some really great people with whom I work with.
cons: The hospital continually has the wrong people in management positions.  I had a horrible manager that was mean spirited, talked bad about nearly everyone and she had the nerve to wonder why people didn't say hi to her or hold conversation with her.  She's IS passive aggressive, extreme micro-manager, everything has to be done her way, she's isn't smart enough to realize that there is more than one way to get to the same end result.  My position has had high turnover and leaders turn a blind eye.  When I would return from a day off, I was always coming into snarky and rude emails over the stupid things, making assumptions instead of asking me first.  I'm not the only employee who feels this way about their manager, there are several people who have made similar comments about their manager.  Happy employees makes for a successful business!

job_title: Transportation Aide in North Kansas City, MO
pros: NKC Hospital is a decent size, but still gives a small community feel.  It is hard to feel lost in the hospital once you have been working there a month or so.  Every employee you see in the hall responds with kind waves and smiles.  It is a great organization to work for, especially if you want to help patients.  North Kansas City is ranked as one of the top hospitals in all of Missouri (I think it's #6 right now) and top rated for the Northland area.  Has a history of growing and bettering the environment over the last few decades.  It's a solid place to start your career, or even a great place to help pay during college years.
cons: Sometimes it is hard being in a position which lacks any kind of authority.  Be sure to stay in your lane.

review_title: Overall a decent place to work.  If you are not in nursing, there is little opportunity for advancement.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in North Kansas City, MO
pros: The benefits are good.  The hospital does a good job of making sure employees have great access to healthcare at a good price.  The cafeterias are great.  The smaller cafe makes dinner items to take home and entire holiday dinners.  The parking garages are covered and safe.  Security does a great job keeping the work environment safe.
cons: Communication.  The communication approach is definitely top down bottom up.  Individual contributions are not encouraged.  There is a definite lack of business processes and procedures.  The lack of written documentation causes frequent rework.  There is a fair amount of gossip, even in management.

job_title: Pbx in North Kansas City, MO
pros: There are some great people and overall the company is supportive of employees.  It's been around a long time and isn't going anywhere.  People in the community think highly of the hospital and many employees seem happy and proud.
cons: Top people make all the decisions.  It's not what you know, it's who you know.  Lots of favoritism in some areas.  Certain departments are dead ends and others get lots of attention.  Employees that are rude, incompetent and have bad attitudes don't get fired, they just get more power.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Gladstone, MO
pros: I have worked at North Kansas City Hospital for six years, this facility has been nurturing and supportive. I have been encouraged from the day I was hired to continue my education and to be involved with unit and hospital initiatives. NKCH as an organization has a heart, they care about patient safety and improving staffing. I feel the administration strives to create a healthy happy work environment and a culture of respect for all staff.
cons: As most facilities experience turnover and short staffing issues, NKCH is no different. At times staffing levels dip as the census rises. This organization does need to improve staff diversity, it is a disadvantage to have very little diversity among staff staff.

job_title: Staff RN in Kansas City, MO
pros: There is a lot of colleague support and team work on the floor that I work. Supervisor is fantastic. We have a stat team that is available 24/7 so if you have a patient who has made a turn for the worse, you have a team to swarm in and help you. They are only a phone call away. This is the only hospital I've ever worked who had such a team available to all nursing staff.
cons: Like all hospitals, we work short a lot which means that you may be primary nurse for up to six patients.

job_title: Hostess in Kansas City, MO
pros: The staff really cares about you , the benefits are great and amazing activities are shared with your employers and the pay was a plus. On top of that the success rate is high when it comes to moving up in the company.
cons: there was no con to working at the hospital. there are only good things to say about the facility . on that note I was more than happy working at the North Kansas City Hospital.

job_title: Registered Nurse in North Kansas City, MO
pros: Nice physical place to work.  Building is being updated but is far behind other area hospitals in decor.  Food is fairly good compared to most hospitals.  Traditional retirement program.
cons: Disrespect abounds.  If you are a nurse expect to put your license on the line.  You are urged to violate nursing standards and hospital policy.  If you have an integrity stay clear.  You will not be promoted for experience or expertise.  You will however be promoted if you party with the "right people"  If you are a normal working person that cares about patient care, and your family don't bother.  Pay and benefits falling below competition.

job_title: in North Kansas City, MO
pros: If you work hard and do well you are recognized and rewarded.  Our department has great leadership and is very fair to the employees.
cons: Always construction taking place.  It is good that the company continues to grow but it is sometimes frustrating that the elevators, hallways or parking lots are closed off.

job_title: CNA in Kansas City, MO
pros: Staff are wonderful, knowledgeable and work well together. Bonus money available
cons:
Your Xmas bonus is 3 movie tickets.no money
They have a point system so if u r 1 min. Late u get one. 8 pts and u r gone!
No recognition. Not enough staff, high ratios!!! I had 17 patients all on my own at 1 time, was told not to give baths.

review_title: If you are a victim of domestic violence do not tell your manager. You will be treated like a criminal.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in North Kansas City, MO
pros: Flex time, friendships developed throughout the hospital, retirement plan,
cons: Pay raises, favoritism rampant, lack of confidentiality of employees personal issues.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Kansas City, MO
pros: The management at North Kansas City Hospital was supportive of their nursing staff and flexible. They care about their nurses. It is a nice place to work.
cons: Like many hospitals in town, their were often times that nurses were understaffed. Also, the pay is much less than other places in town.

review_title: Best place I’ve ever worked. Fact.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Kansas City, MO
pros: Magnet hospital. Treats its employees VERY well. Diverse work dynamic and everyone is a team player. Outstanding employer!!!
cons: Strict dress code; no piercings allowed. (Except ears.)

job_title: Registered Nurse in North Kansas City, MO
pros: Still has a traditional retirement plan.
cons: NKCH used to be a great place to work.  In recent years nurses are very unhappy and most are seeking employment elsewhere.  Nursing management micromanages, and gives lip service with a smirk to autonomy.  Nurses are routinely thrown under the bus when trying to be patient advocates. Don't expect respect.  Administration demonstrates a lack of regard for professional nurses.  I used to LOVE working here.  Now it's all I can do to drag myself back each day.

job_title: CNA in Kansas City, MO
pros: Excellent experience. 10 HSP night shift crew is excellent. They have great team work skills.
cons: Racist employees.  Security harassing nursing staff.  If African American or of color. You will get treated differently. From upper authority and security.  I’ve witnessed mistreatment of pt due to the color of their skin.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Kansas City, MO

I love being a nurse again because of NKCH!!!

There is praise for laziness.
